text: The Nifty Nineties is an animated short film. It was produced in Technicolor by Walt Disney Productions and released to theaters on June 20, 1941 by RKO Radio Pictures. ==Notes== Part of the dance sequence with Fred and Ward was reused in a scene in Jiminy Cricket's You and Your Senses of Taste and Smell. ==Voice cast== * Mickey Mouse: Walt Disney * Minnie Mouse: Thelma Boardman * Fred: Fred Moore * Ward: Ward Kimball * Hens: Florence Gill And Gertrude Lawrence * Singers: Thurl Ravenscroft, Max Smith, John Rarig, Bill Days ==Home media== The short was released on May 18, 2004 on Walt Disney Treasures: Mickey Mouse in Living Color, Volume Two: 1939-Today. ==References== ==Other websites== * * The Nifty Nineties at The Encyclopedia of Animated Disney Shorts * The Nifty Nineties at the Big Cartoon DataBase * Category:1941 comedy movies Category:Disney animated movies
title: The Nifty Nineties
